articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, SAMY MAGDY and RAVI NESSMAN
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees warned Wednesday that without immediate deliveries of fuel it will soon have to sharply cut back relief operations across the Gaza Strip, which has been blockaded and hit by devastating Israeli airstrikes since Hamas militants launched an attack on Israel more than two weeks ago.
articles.title: UN warns Gaza blockade could force it to sharply cut relief operations as bombings rise

articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, SAMY MAGDY and RAVI NESSMAN
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees warned Wednesday that without immediate deliveries of fuel it will soon have to sharply cut back relief operations across the Gaza Strip, which has been blockaded and hit by devastating Israeli airstrikes since Hamas militants launched an attack on Israel more than two weeks ago.
articles.title: UN warns Gaza blockade could force it to sharply cut relief operations as bombings rise

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — The leader of Lebanon’s Hezbollah group held talks on Wednesday with senior Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad figures in a key meeting of three top anti-Israel militant groups amid the war raging in Gaza.
articles.title: Leader of Lebanon's Hezbollah holds talks with senior Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad figures

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI, LOLITA C. BALDOR, and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House said Tuesday that “prudent contingency planning” is underway to evacuate Americans from the Middle East in case the Israel-Hamas war spreads into a broad regional conflict.
articles.title: US developing contingency plans to evacuate Americans from Mideast in case Israel-Hamas war spreads

articles.author: JOSÉ ANTONIO RIVERA and MARÍA VERZA
articles.description: ACAPULCO, Mexico (AP) — Hurricane Otis slammed into Mexico’s southern Pacific coast as a catastrophic Category 5 hurricane early Wednesday, bringing dangerous winds and heavy rain to Acapulco and surrounding towns, stirring memories of a 1997 storm that killed dozens of people.
articles.title: Hurricane Otis weakens to Category 4 storm while heavy rains and flash floods batter southern Mexico

articles.author: LISA MASCARO, STEPHEN GROVES, FARNOUSH AMIRI and KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republicans chose Rep. Mike Johnson as their latest nominee for House speaker desperate to unite their fractious majority and end the chaos, just hours after an earlier pick abruptly withdrew in the face of opposition from Donald Trump.
articles.title: Mike Johnson is the latest GOP nominee for House speaker as Republican infighting shows no end

articles.author: JUSTIN KABUMBA and ZANE IRWIN
articles.description: BULENGO, Congo (AP) — A hooded man burst into the 42-year-old woman's tent while her children were out searching for food, then raped her in the displacement camp where she had fled war in eastern Congo.
articles.title: 'I wanted to scream': Growing conflict in Congo drives sexual assault against displaced women

articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In a courtroom showdown five years in the making, Donald Trump's fixer-turned-foe Michael Cohen testified Tuesday that he worked to boost the supposed value of the former president's assets to “whatever number Trump told us to."
articles.title: In court faceoff, Michael Cohen testifies against Trump in fraud trial. Trump shrugs: 'Proven liar'

articles.author: HUIZHONG WU
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — China said the United States is the “biggest disruptor of regional peace and stability” in the world in a scathing response Wednesday to a Pentagon report on China's growing military buildup.
articles.title: China said the US is a disruptor of peace in response to Pentagon report on China’s military buildup

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan’s Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that a law requiring transgender people to undergo sterilization surgery in order to officially change their gender is unconstitutional.The decision by the top court’s 15-judge Grand Bench was its first on the constitutionality of Japan’s 2003 law requiring the removal of sex organs for a state-recognized gender change, a practice long criticized by international rights and medical groups.
articles.title: Japan’s top court strikes down required sterilization surgery to officially change gender
